pages.text: The $(item)Dimensional Nexus$() is one of the more curious devices. When sent into the world, it will create a connection to the Outer and the Inner Threshold, the borders of Beyond and the Mind respectively.

In order to take advantage of this connection, a "qualified user" must use an $(item)Incantation$() in close proximity of the nexus. A qualified user is everyone who either is the owner of the nexus, or is in the same cult as the owner (see: $(l:lessons/entry_cult)Cults$()). $(br)An active rite will drain the Magan of all qualified participants. Further information on how much energy is required for the rite is written on the incantation.

Additionally, each rite needs a certain minimal amount of $(marked)item power$() and certain $(marked)aspects$(), both of which are specified on the incantation.$(br)In order to get certain aspects for a rite or to push up the amount of item power, $(item)Rite Tools$() or $(item)Materials$() must be used, tools or materials with aspects and power. $(br)These must be held by the cultists close to the altar. Materials will get consumed, tools will not.

Additionally, the tool power will only increase if the tool's aspects are relevant. $(br)Once all aspects are present and the item power of the rite tools is greater or equal to the power needed, the rite will be finished. $(br)It should be noted, that some rites have an effect during the performing of the rite and that sometimes a certain soul type is required.

If a certain soul type $(o) is$() required, it is written on the incantation.$(br2)Rites can always be stopped by using the same incantation again, and the Nexus can always be removed by the owner. This is done by hitting it while sneaking.
